meanings.definition: A newspaper article written by or on behalf of an editor that gives an opinion on a topical issue.
meanings.sent1: The editorials in the paper discussed the upcoming election.
meanings.sent2: I always enjoy reading the editorials in the newspaper.
meanings.sent3: The editorials in the paper made me chuckle with their witty remarks.
meanings.sent4: Her editorials were like a beacon of light in the sea of news articles.
meanings.sent5: The editorials painted a vivid picture of the community's concerns.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the content or style of editorials.
meanings.sent1: She had a keen interest in the editorial section and its editorial style.
meanings.sent2: The editorial team worked on improving the editorial content.
meanings.sent3: His editorial choice of words was both unique and effective.
meanings.sent4: The editorial influence could be seen in the overall tone of the publication.
meanings.sent5: The editorial changes brought a fresh perspective to the magazine.

meanings.definition: The section of a newspaper or magazine that contains editorials.
meanings.sent1: I always turn to the editorials first when I read the newspaper.
meanings.sent2: The editorial section of the magazine was filled with diverse opinions.
meanings.sent3: The editorial section felt like a hidden gem among the news.
meanings.sent4: The editorial section served as a platform for public discourse.
meanings.sent5: The editorial section was a treasure trove of insightful commentary.
